content: is smoking more healthy than drinking <@U08B132LUBZ>

Both smoking and alcohol consumption pose serious health risks, with links to major diseases []. The effects of smoking and alcohol on the brain appear to be similar, generally reducing brain health []. For the same level of mortality risk, 5 drinks a day is equivalent to smoking about 4-5 cigarettes daily [].

Both smoking and drinking pose serious health risks, with links to major diseases []. Combining both smoking and alcohol consumption can be particularly harmful []. The risks from consuming a standard drink can equal smoking several cigarettes a day [].

Both smoking and alcohol consumption pose serious health risks []. The risk of alcohol use on premature death can be equivalent to smoking multiple cigarettes a day []. Combining both smoking and alcohol leads to a greater risk of harm than either alone [].
